Author: TAG-70 a.k.a. Winter Vivern, TA473 and UAC0114
Target: Government and military organizations in Georgia, Poland, and Ukraine and Iran embassies in Europe
Description: Researchers from Recorded Future uncover a campaign carried out by TAG-70, a threat actors operating with interests aligned to Belarus and Russia that likely exploited cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in CVE-2023-43770 Roundcube webmail servers to target over 80 organizations.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Cisco reveal the details of Agniane Stealer, an information-stealing malware mainly targeting the cryptocurrency wallets of its victims.

Author: Threat actors from Russia
Target: Several popular Ukrainian media outlets including Ukrainska Pravda and Liga.net
Description: Russian hackers attacked several popular Ukrainian media outlets, posting fake news related to the war.

Target: El Al plane flying from Phuket to Ben-Gurion
Description: "Hostile elements" attempt to take over the communication network of an El Al plane flying from Phuket to Ben-Gurion Airport and divert it from its destination.

Target: Android users in the UK, Germany, Spain, Slovakia, Slovenia, and the Czech Republic.
Description: Researchers from ThreatFabric discover five campaigns of the Anatsa banking trojan aimed at users in the UK, Germany, Spain, Slovakia, Slovenia, and the Czech Republic.
Country: CZ DE ES GB SI SK

Description: Researchers from Patchstack reveal that threat actors are actively exploiting CVE-2024-25600, a critical remote code execution (RCE) flaw impacting the Bricks Builder Theme to run malicious PHP code on vulnerable sites.

Author: Threat actor from North Korea
Target: Undisclosed research center for maritime and shipping technologies
Description: Germany's federal intelligence agency (BfV) and South Korea's National Intelligence Service (NIS) warn of an ongoing cyber-espionage operation targeting the global defense sector on behalf of the North Korean government.

Author: Lazarus
Description: Germany's federal intelligence agency (BfV) and South Korea's National Intelligence Service (NIS) warn that Lazarus group's "Operation Dream Job," was also used against the defense sector.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Resecurity identify an increasing trend of cryptocurrency counterfeiting, with several tokens impersonating major brands, government organizations and national fiat currencies.

Author: Anonymous Sudan
Description: The University of Cambridge is hit with a DDoS attack. The Anonymous Sudan group claims responsibility for the attack.

Author: Anonymous Sudan
Description: The University of Manchester is hit with a DDoS attack. The Anonymous Sudan group claims responsibility for the attack.
FixedFloat, a decentralized crypto exchange, is hacked via a crypto drainer, for at least $26 million worth of Bitcoin and Ethereum.
Researchers at Cado Security discover a new campaign targeting Redis servers on Linux hosts using a piece of malware called ‘Migo’ to mine for cryptocurrency.
Researchers from Sysdig reveal that a threat actor is using an open-source network mapping tool named SSH-Snake to look for private keys undetected and move laterally on the victim infrastructure.
Researchers from Cisco Talos warn of hackers abusing the Google Cloud Run service to distribute massive volumes of banking trojans like Astaroth, Mekotio, and Ousaban.

Author: Earth Preta (a.k.a. Mustang Panda and Bronze President)
Target: Government organizations in Taiwan, Vietnam, Malaysia, and other Asian countries
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro discover a new campaign carried out by the Earth Preta group, using a customized PlugX malware variant named DOPLUGS.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from ReversingLabs discover NP6HelperHttptest and NP6HelperHttper, two malicious packages on the Python Package Index (PyPI) repository that were found leveraging a technique called DLL side-loading to circumvent detection by security software and run malicious code.

Author: Threat actors from North Korea
Description: Researchers from Phylum discover a set of fake npm packages on the Node.js repository linked with North Korean state-sponsored actors.

China's Ministry of Industry and Information Technology warns local netizens that fake wallet apps for the nation's central bank digital currency (CBDC) are already circulating and being abused by scammers.

Author: Blind Eagle (a.k.a. APT-C-36)
Target: Spanish-speaking users in the manufacturing industry based in North America
Description: Researchers from eSentire observe the threat actor known as Blind Eagle using a loader malware called Ande Loader to deliver remote access trojans (RATs) like Remcos RAT and NjRAT.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: A day after ScreenConnect publishes the security issues affecting its products, attackers start leveraging the vulnerabilities in attacks.

Author: ALPHV a.k.a. BlackCat
Description: Healthcare giant UnitedHealth Group confirms that its subsidiary Optum is forced to shut down IT systems and various services after a cyberattack by “nation-state” hackers on the Change Healthcare platform. The ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack.

Date Occurred: During November 2023 and end of December 2023
Date Discovered: During November 2023 and end of December 2023
Author: COLDRIVER a.k.a. Callisto
Description: Researchers from ESET discover Operation Texonto, a new influence operation targeting Ukraine that leverages spam emails to propagate war-related disinformation.

Author: COLDRIVER a.k.a. Callisto
Target: Defense company in Ukraine and undisclosed EU agency
Description: Researchers from ESET discover a spearphishing campaign targeting a Ukrainian defense company in October 2023 and an EU agency in November 2023. The goal of both was to steal credentials for Microsoft Office 365 accounts.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Group-IB uncover VietCredCare, a previously unknown information stealer targeting Facebook advertisers in Vietnam.

Author: Konni (a.k.a. Opal Sleet, Osmium, or TA406)
Target: Russian Consular Department of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MID)
Description: Researchers from DCSO reveal that an installer for 'Statistika KZU' (Cтатистика КЗУ), a tool likely used by the Russian Consular Department of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MID) has been backdoored to deliver a remote access trojan called Konni RAT (a.k.a. UpDog).
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Australian telecommunications provider Tangerine announces that the personal information of 230,000 individuals was stolen in a recent cyberattack.

Researchers from Aqua unveil a new campaign targeting Apache big-data stack, specifically Apache Hadoop and Apache Druid, exploits existing misconfigurations and vulnerabilities to enslave them in the Lucifer botnet.
Chinese PC maker Acemagic admits that some of its products shipped with pre-installed malware.
Researches from Sucuri discover a surge in attacks by Angel Drainer, a novel form of website malware targeting Web3 and cryptocurrency assets.
Maryville, which operates several addiction recovery centers around South Jersey, announces it was the victim of a data breach that accessed Social Security numbers and other personal information,

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: The U.S. CISA adds CVE-2024-1709 to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog.

Researchers from Sophos reveal that threat actors are deploying the buhtiRansom LockBit ransomware variant on victims' systems after gaining access using exploits targeting the CVE-2024-1708 and CVE-2024-1709 ScreenConnect vulnerabilities.
U-Haul starts informing customers that a threat actor used stolen account credentials to access an internal system for dealers and team members to track customer reservations.

Researchers from Phylum discover that a dormant package named django-log-tracker, available on the Python Package Index (PyPI) repository was updated nearly after two years to propagate an information stealer malware called Nova Sentinel.

Chinese police are investigating an unauthorized and highly unusual online dump of documents from  I-Soon, a private security contractor linked to the nation’s top policing agency and other parts of its government.
Researchers from Uptycs discover a campaign exploiting multiple vulnerabilities, including CVE-2021-44228 and CVE-2022-26134, to mine cryptocurrencies.
Attack: Multiple vulnerabilities including CVE-2021-44228 and CVE-2022-26134

Author: Doppelgänger
Target: Audiences in the US, Israel, Germany, and France.
Description: A joint effort by SentinelLabs and ClearSky Cyber Security uncover a significant propaganda and disinformation campaign, possibly orchestrated by the Russia-aligned influence operation network called Doppelgänger.

Author: M.O.R.E (Multi OS Ransomware Executable)
Description: A new ransomware threat dubbed M.O.R.E (Multi OS Ransomware Executable), emerges in the dark web.

Target: Organizations in the Oil and Gas industry
Description: Researchers from Cofense discover a campaign delivering the Rhadamanthys stealer to targets in the Oil and Gas industry.
Bimbo Bakeries USA, the U.S. branch of baking giant Grupo Bimbo suffers a ransomware attack by the Medusa ransomware group.
The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP), Canada's national police force, discloses that it recently faced a cyber attack targeting its networks.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Steel giant ThyssenKrupp confirms that threat actors breached systems in its Automotive division, forcing them to shut down IT systems as part of its response and containment effort. Few days later the company confirms a ransomware attack.

Researchers from Wordfence disclose CVE-2024-1071, a critical security flaw  in a popular WordPress plugin called Ultimate Member that has more than 200,000 active installations and it's currently under active exploration.

Author: moom825
Description: Researchers from Cyfirma discover Xeno RAT, an "intricately designed" remote access trojan available on GitHub, making it easily accessible to other actors at no extra cost, and already distributed in campaigns via the Discord CDN.
Jeff “Jihoz” Zirlin, one of the co-founders of the video game Axie Infinity and the related Ronin Network has nearly $10 million in cryptocurrency stolen from personal accounts.

Author: IntelBroker
Description: IntelBroker claims to have breached the database of the Los Angeles Airport, exploiting a vulnerability in the CRM system, and resulting in the compromise of 2.5 million records of plane owners.
The Malawi government reportedly suspends issuing passports for the past two weeks due to what appears to be a ransomware attack on the immigration service's computer network.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: medQ files a notice of data breach after discovering that hackers accessed and encrypted a software platform used by medQ.

Author: Kimsuky
Description: Researchers from AhnLab discover a new campaign carried out by the Korean Kimsuky distributing the TrollAgent malware disguised as security programs on a Korean construction-related association's website.
Threat actors are exploiting FCKeditor, a CMS editor discontinued 14 years ago, to compromise education and government entities worldwide to poison search results with malicious sites or scams.

Researchers from at Guardio Labs discover a massive ad fraud campaign named "SubdoMailing", using over 8,000 legitimate internet domains and 13,000 subdomains to send up to five million emails per day to generate revenue through scams and malvertising.

Author: APT29 (a.k.a. Cozy Bear, Midnight Blizzard, The Dukes)
Description: Members of the Five Eyes (FVEY) intelligence alliance warn that APT29 Russian Foreign Intelligence Service (SVR) threat actors are now switching to attacks targeting their victims' cloud services.

Author: UAC-0184
Description: Researchers from Morphisec discover a  group tracked as 'UAC-0184' observed utilizing steganographic image files to deliver the Remcos remote access trojan (RAT) onto the systems of a Ukrainian entity operating in Finland.

Author: ALPHV a.k.a. BlackCat
Description: The Hessen Consumer Center in Germany is hit with a ransomware attack, causing IT systems to shut down and temporarily disrupting its availability. The ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack.
An open redirect vulnerability in the remains of Google Web Light service, is actively exploited in multiple phishing campaigns.

Author: Akira
Description: The Akira ransomware group claims responsibility for a cyber attack to Quik Pawn Shop.

Author: Black Basta
Description: Das Team Ag, a job placement agency with 25 branches across Switzerland and the Principality of Liechtenstein, confirms that they fell victim to a cyberattack by the Black Basta ransomware group.

Author: Threat actors from China (Earth Lusca)
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro discover a new campaign that used Chinese-Taiwanese relations as a social engineering lure to infect selected targets.
Researchers from Forcepoint discover a campaign targeting organizations in the travel industry with the Agent Tesla malware.
Researchers from AhnLab discover Nood RAT, a Gh0st RAT variant for Linux, being utilized in malware campaigns aiming to steal sensitive data from Linux servers.

The social media account on X, formerly Twitter, of MicroStrategy falls victim to a hacking incident, resulting in the posting of malicious links related to a phony airdrop for an ethereum-based crypto token. The scam causes losses exceeding $440,000.
Malicious JavaScript code hidden in a Tornado Cash governance proposal has been leaking deposit notes and data to a private server for almost two months.

Author: APT28, a.k.a. Fancy Bear and Sednit
Description: The FBI says in a joint advisory issued with the NSA, the U.S. Cyber Command, and international partners, that Russian threat actors from APT28 are using compromised Ubiquiti EdgeRouters to build extensive botnets that help them steal credentials, collect NTLMv2 digests, and proxy malicious traffic.

Author: Black Basta and Bl00dy
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro reveal that the Black Basta and Bl00dy ransomware gangs have joined widespread attacks targeting ScreenConnect servers unpatched against CVE-2024-1708 and CVE-2024-1709, two maximum severity authentication bypass vulnerabilities.

Author: ALPHV a.k.a. BlackCat
Description: The FBI, CISA, and the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) warn U.S. healthcare organizations of targeted ALPHV/Blackcat ransomware attacks.
Pharmaceutical giant Cencora says they suffered a cyberattack where threat actors stole data from corporate IT systems.

Researchers from JFrog discover at least 100 instances of malicious AI ML models on the Hugging Face platform, some of which can execute code on the victim's machine, giving attackers a persistent backdoor.

Author: LightBasin' a.k.a. UNC1945
Description: A security researcher named HaxRob discovers a previously unknown Linux backdoor named GTPDOOR, designed for covert operations within mobile carrier networks.
Researchers from Cisco Talos uncover a campaign targeting Mexican users with tax-themed phishing lures to distribute a previously undocumented Windows malware called TimbreStealer.

Author: UNC1549 a.ka. Smoke Sandstorm (previously Bohrium), Crimson Sandstorm (previously Curium), Imperial Kitten, TA456, Tortoiseshell, Yellow Liderc
Target: Aerospace, aviation, and defense industries in the Middle East, including Israel and the U.A.E
Description: Researchers from Mandiant expose a campaign carried out by an Iran-nexus threat actor known as UNC1549  targeting aerospace, aviation, and defense industries in the Middle East, including Israel and the U.A.E through two backdoors dubbed MiniBike and MiniBus.

Author: SPIKEDWINE
Description: Researchers from Zscaler observe a previously undocumented threat actor dubbed SPIKEDWINE targeting officials in European countries with Indian diplomatic missions using a new backdoor called WINELOADER.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Hochschule Kempten, a university of applied sciences in the city of Kempten in Germany, announces being targeted by a criminal cyberattack that forced the institution to take down its IT infrastructure.

Author: Mogilevich
Description: Ireland’s Department of Foreign Affairs (DFA) investigates a possible breach after an extortion group named Mogilevich claims to have stolen 7GB of compromised documents for sale.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Mogilevich
Description: The Mogilevich group also lists three undisclosed companies on their site.

Author: Russia
Description: Ukraine's military intelligence unit warns that Russia has poured more than $1 billion into “Maidan-3”, an ongoing disinformation campaign aimed to diminish Western support for Kyiv and sow panic and distrust among Ukrainian citizens.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: UNC5325
Description: Researchers from Mandiant reveal that a Chinese threat actor tracked as UNC5325 has been observed exploiting the Ivanti CVE-2024-21893 to deploy new malware families such as LittleLamb.WoolTea, PitStop, Pitdog, PitJet, and PitHook.
European discount retailer Pepco Group reveals that its Hungarian business has lost a significant amount of money (€15.5 Million) to cybercriminals.

Author: Akira
Description: The Akira ransomware group threatens to leak nearly 200GB of stolen data from Bjuv Municipality’s systems.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Bitdefender discover a new variant of the AMOS (Atomic) Stealer, leveraging a Python script to stay covert.

Author: Savvy Seahorse
Description: Researchers from Infoblox reveal that a threat actor named Savvy Seahorse is abusing CNAME DNS records Domain Name System to create a traffic distribution system that powers financial scam campaigns.

Author: Lazarus
Description: Japan's Computer Security Incident Response Team (JPCERT/CC) warns that the notorious North Korean hacking group Lazarus has uploaded four malicious PyPI packages to infect developers with malware.

Author: Lazarus
Description: Researchers from Avast reveal that North Korean threat actors known as the Lazarus Group exploited CVE-2024-21338, a flaw in the Windows AppLocker driver (appid.sys) as a zero-day to gain kernel-level access and turn off security tools, allowing them to bypass noisy BYOVD (Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver) techniques.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The LockBit ransomware gang is once again conducting attacks, using updated encryptors with ransom notes linking to new servers after last week's law enforcement disruption.
According to a wave of online reports from Anycubic customers, someone hacked their 3D printers to warn that the devices are exposed to attacks.
Houser LLP, a U.S. law firm that specializes in serving high-profile financial institutions, says a system breach discovered in May 2023 exposed the personal data of more than 325,000 people.

Researchers from CloudSEK reveal that Cybercriminals are using a massive network of hired mules in India and xHelper, an Android-based money transfer application to launder illicit proceeds, researchers have found.
Anycubic customers report that their 3D printers were hacked, displaying a message warning of an alleged security flaw in the company’s systems.

Threat actors are targeting people in the cryptocurrency space in attacks that start with a link added to the target’s calendar at Calendly, a popular application for scheduling appointments and meetings.
Researchers from Apiiro discover an ongoing attack flooding more than 100,000 GitHub repositories with obfuscated malware that steals passwords and cryptocurrency from developer devices.

Author: Voltzite
Target: Electric transmission and distribution organizations in African nations
Description: Researchers from Dragos reveal that "Voltzite," the operational technology (OT)-focused unit within China's Volt Typhoon APT, is targeting electric transmission and distribution organizations in African nations

Author: KryptonZambie
Description: AI service Cutout.Pro suffers a data breach exposing the personal information of 20 million members, including email addresses, hashed and salted passwords, IP addresses, and names.

Target: Cryptocurrency platforms and the Federal Communications Commission (FCC)
Description: Researchers from Lookout discover CryptoChameleon, an advanced phishing kit exhibiting novel tactics to target cryptocurrency platforms as well as the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) via mobile devices.

Researchers from Palo Alto Networks discover a new Linux variant of the Bifrost (a.k.a. Bifrose) remote access trojan (RAT) employing several novel evasion techniques, including the use of a deceptive domain that was made to appear as part of VMware.
The Golden Corral American restaurant chain discloses a data breach after attackers behind an August cyberattack stole the personal information of over 180,000 people.
The U.S. CISA adds CVE-2023-29360, a high-severity vulnerability in the Microsoft Streaming Service (MSKSSRV.SYS) actively exploited in attacks, to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: The Five Eyes (FVEY) intelligence alliance issues a new cybersecurity advisory warning of cyber threat actors exploiting known security flaws in Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure gateways, noting that the Integrity Checker Tool (ICT) can be deceived to provide a false sense of security.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Phobos
Description: The U.S. cybersecurity and intelligence agencies CISA, FBI, and MS-ISAC warn of Phobos ransomware attacks targeting government and critical infrastructure entities.

The Taiwan ministry of national defense says that threat actors stole “sensitive information” including military and government documents from Chunghwa Telecom, Taiwan’s largest telecom company and sold it on the dark web.
Researchers from Malwarebytes discover a campaign where scammers on Airbnb are faking technical issues and citing higher fees to get users to a spoofed Tripadvisor website and steal their money.
The Chelan County Public Utility District is impacted by a “cybersecurity event" that kept a nationwide vendor from mailing and emailing statements.
Threat actors steal $6 million from the Seneca stablecoin protocol across the Ethereum and Arbitrum networks by exploiting a bug in the protocol's smart contract approval mechanisms
